VIII.ii.1.D.2.c
.
Requesting Examinations in Claims for Infectious Diseases
Use the table below when an examination and/or medical opinion is needed to decide a claim for infectious disease under
38 CFR 3.317
.
If the claim involves a(n) ...
Then ...
infectious disease listed in
38 CFR 3.317(c)
request the appropriate infectious diseases DBQ to evaluate current severity.
Note
:  As presumptive SC applies to the infectious disease under
38 CFR 3.317
, a medical opinion is not required.
long-term health effect potentially associated with an infectious disease as noted in
38 CFR 3.317(d)
request a medical opinion as to whether it is at least as likely as not that the condition was caused by the Veteran having had the infectious disease.
Important
:
Do not request a Gulf War general medical examination for infectious disease claims.
The Acceptable Clinical Evidence (ACE) examination process may be used when processing these claims, when deemed appropriate.
Reference
:  For more information on ACE examinations, see
M21-1, Part IV, Subpart i, 2.A.4
.
